alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Washington (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Weirton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moon Township, Aliquippa, Robinson Township, Kennedy Township, Ambridge, Coraopolis, Sewickley, Harmony Township, Imperial, Leetsdale, Shippingport, Edgeworth, Burgettstown, Sewickley Heights, Glen Osborne, South Heights, Hookstown, Frankfort Springs, Haysville, and Enlow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 63. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 43 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
